intro: Petasites, commonly known as butterbush or edelweiss, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. They are native to temperate and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Petasites species often grow in moist, shaded environments and are known for their ability to thrive in cool, high-altitude conditions. The genus includes both herbaceous and shrub-like species, with some being cultivated for ornamental purposes.
